page.title: 18Saint Rollox Church
page.content: St.Rollox Church was 130 years old in 1985.On 19th Dec.1984 the congregation entered the 3rd church building during that time.The first was in Tharsis St. The 2nd building had been threatened by proposed realignment of Springburn Rd.Repairs had not been done and it was abandoned.Vandals set it on fire. The congregation met in a school until the opening of the new church,the only centrally funded church built by the Church of Scotland in 1984.From the Rev.D.Forrest,the 1st minister in 1885 there have been 8 ministers including the present,Rev.Gwynfai Jones. St.Roch,or St.Rollox,was born c1296 in Montpellier in France.A red cross was said to appear on his breast at birth. During his lifetime he was reputed to bring about cures of the plague. Churches in various places are named after St.Roch,Rowk,Rollock or Rollox.
